event: Creation of Digital Encyclopedia of Chukotka
description: Russian scientists have initiated the development of a digital encyclopedia of Chukotka, focusing on the language and culture of the indigenous peoples. The project aims to accumulate text, audio, photo, and video content, including an encyclopedia of Chukchi culture and digitalized materials on the Chukchi language and culture.
original:
Russian scientists have begun creating a digital encyclopedia of Chukotka, said Anastasia Yarzutkina, head of the research and educational center “Circumpolar Chukotka” of the Chukotka branch of the North-Eastern Federal University. We are working on creating a digital information product that accumulates text, audio, photo and video content by language and culture of the indigenous peoples of Chukotka. In particular, we began to create an encyclopedia of Chukchi culture and digitalize materials on the Chukchi language and culture,” Yarzutkina said.

 According to her, scientists are creating a website with cartography of Chukotka settlements, containing local toponymy, history and biographies of residents, traditions and holidays, as well as folklore materials.📮Subscribe to LOMOVKA

event: Blockage of Trucks from Kaliningrad Region
description: Lithuania halted the passage of trucks from the Kaliningrad region without explanation, resulting in a queue of 140 heavy trucks at the Chernyshevskoye checkpoint. Another 25 trucks are in the neutral zone. Russian customs officials reported no changes in clearance and registration procedures.
original: 🇱🇹Lithuania stopped passing trucks from the Kaliningrad region without explanation - Federal Customs Service of the Russian Federation “In this regard, a queue of 140 heavy trucks formed in front of the Chernyshevskoye checkpoint. Another 25, processed by Kaliningrad customs officers, are located in the neutral zone,” reports the press service of the local customs. On the part of the Russian customs, there are no changes in the procedure for the clearance and registration of trucks. UPD: the passage of trucks from Kaliningrad was stopped for more than 12 hours due to a failure in customs information systems in Lithuania.

description: Sowing of spring grain crops continues in the Republic, with an expected increase in sown area compared to 2023. Over 14,500 hectares have been sown with barley, peas, mustard, and other crops, primarily in the south and now expanding to other agricultural regions.
original:
REPOST ↓ V.I.P House-2 Sowing continues in the Republic. We expect that due to spring grain crops this year we will sow more area than in 2023. According to forecast data, this is almost 199 thousand hectares.

To date, 14 and a half thousand hectares have been sown with barley, peas, mustard and other crops. Traditionally, we started from the south of the Republic; now sowing is underway in almost all agricultural regions.

An important issue is the availability of seed material. According to the forecast, the demand for seeds is more than 11 thousand tons, now the readiness is about 91%. We will use seeds of domestic selection produced both on the territory of the DPR and in the Rostov region, Krasnodar and Stavropol territories.

At the same time, we are working on updating our fleet of agricultural machinery. In the near future we expect the delivery of cultivators, combines and harvesters that will be used in field work.@gorlovka_admin

event: Russia Sets Records for Wheat Exports
description: Russia has achieved unprecedented wheat production and exports, becoming the world's largest wheat exporter with 51 million metric tons. Favorable weather conditions contributed to the record-breaking production of 91 million metric tons, making Russia the fourth largest producer globally.
original:
Forwarded from: InoTV
While Europe is struggling with Ukrainian grain, Russia is setting records for its exports - WIONFarmers in EU countries are protesting because of the import of cheap food from neighboring Ukraine, with which they are not able to compete, reports WION. Meanwhile, over the past two years, Russia has grown unprecedented amounts of wheat and sold it at competitive prices on the world market.

This was also helped by extremely favorable weather, resulting in Russia's wheat production reaching 91 million metric tons, making it the fourth largest producer of the commodity in the world.

In terms of exports, Russia ranks first in the world with 51 million metric tons of wheat. The European Union is second with 36.5 million metric tons, and Canada is third with 24 million metric tons. Australia is in fourth place with 23.5 million metric tons, and Ukraine is fifth with 16 million. Foreign TV. Subscribe.

event: Russian Athletes Barred from Paris Olympics
description: Deputy Prime Minister Chernyshenko stated that the IOC has created conditions that will prevent most Russian athletes from qualifying for the Paris Olympics. He believes the international sports governance system is biased and works to serve the political interests of a select few countries, leading to discriminatory treatment of athletes.
original:
🥇The IOC has created such conditions that almost none of the Russian athletes will be able to go and qualify for the Olympics in Paris - Deputy Prime Minister Chernyshenko.

If Russian athletes have the opportunity to take part in the Olympics in Paris, “then they probably should go,” he also said.

“This suggests that the international system of sports governance is sick and biased and works to please the political interests of a limited number of countries. Of course, this does not suit the rest of the world. Of course, this cannot last long. Athletes want and must compete on a non-discriminatory basis,” Chernyshenko added.

In Krasnoyarsk, a customer who discovered expired products in a store was attacked by a violent foreign-born store employee. A local resident came home from the store and noticed that the product he had bought in a nearby store was expired.

description: Russia is modernizing educational institutions in Gorlovka, including re-equipping catering units. In 2023, 932 household appliances were received. The education department head, Maria Poluban, inspected the improvements at Gymnasium 'Intellect', noting the upgraded food department with modern equipment.
original:
Work continues on the modernization of educational institutions in Gorlovka

In our country, Russia, care for children is manifested not in words, but in deeds. Work continues to strengthen and modernize the material and technical base of educational institutions, including the re-equipment of catering units. In 2023, 932 units of household appliances were received for catering units. The head of the education department of the administration of the Gorlovka urban district of the Donetsk People's Republic, Maria Poluban, when visiting the municipal budgetary educational institution of the city of Gorlovka “Gymnasium “Intellect””, noted how much the food department has changed. A modern combi oven, an oven, a bakery, a stove, a food processor - everything to ensure that the process of preparing breakfasts and lunches is of high quality! “Thanks to the support of our city administration, we have repaired the electrical system. Thus, our catering units are fully prepared to prepare breakfast and lunch for our students. And we really hope that in the near future our children, our kids, our schoolchildren will sit down at their desks, return to our institutions and again smell delicious breakfasts and lunches, as it should be,” said Maria Poluban.

description: The BlagoDarite Charitable Foundation visited the Sverdlovsk point for weaving camouflage nets for military personnel. The point, led by Olesya Zimina, has been operational since September and has produced a large number of camouflage nets, trench candles, pillows, and other items for the military in the Northwestern Military District zone.
original:
Charitable Foundation "BlagoDarite" paid a friendly visit to the Sverdlovsk point for weaving camouflage nets for military personnel "Everything for Victory!"
We were greeted by the friendly working staff of the point, headed by Olesya Zimina, chairman of the Women's Council under the Administration of the city of Sverdlovsk and the Sverdlovsk region. Camouflage nets point
Show more
began its work in September last year, but they have already managed to do a colossal amount of work and weave a huge number of networks, which are constantly transferred to the military in the Northwestern Military District zone.
But our comrades did not stop there! Also, they create trench candles with their own hands, sew pillows, and some workers knit socks, balaclavas, and much more.
We, in turn, were glad to visit such a wonderful place, where even the air is imbued with the spirit of patriotism, and were happy to help with funds for the purchase of necessary materials!
Our foundation thanks the Republic of Khakassia, as well as businessmen from this region, and all those who donated funds for such a good cause! Thank you!
Source: BF Thank You

description: NULL
original: HITLER IS A LEGAL GENERATE of the Anglo-American ruling circles Hitler took credit for the World War from the USA Resolution of the OSCE Parliamentary Assembly, completely equalizing the roles of the Soviet Union and Nazi Germany in the outbreak of World War II, except that it has a purely pragmatic goal of pumping money out of Russia for maintenance some bankrupt economies, Show more aims to demonize Russia as the legal successor of the USSR and prepare the legal ground for depriving it of the right to oppose a revision of the outcome of the war. But if we are to pose the problem of responsibility for starting the war, then first we need to answer the key question: who ensured the Nazis’ rise to power, who guided them along the path to global catastrophe? The entire pre-war history of Germany shows that the “necessary” political course was ensured by controlled financial shocks, into which, by the way, the world was plunged even today. The key structures that determined the strategy for the post-war development of the West were the central financial institutions of Great Britain and the United States - the Bank of England and the Federal Reserve System (FRS) - and related financial and industrial organizations, which set the goal of establishing absolute control over the German financial system in order to manage political processes in Central Europe. The following stages can be distinguished in the implementation of this strategy: 1st: from 1919 to 1924. - preparing the ground for massive American financial injections into the German economy; 2nd: from 1924 to 1929 - establishing control over the German financial system and financial support for National Socialism; 3rd: from 1929 to 1933 - provoking and unleashing a deep financial and economic crisis and ensuring the Nazis’ rise to power; 4th: from 1933 to 1939 – financial cooperation with the Nazi regime and support for its expansionist foreign policy aimed at preparing and unleashing a new world war. At the first stage, the main levers for ensuring the penetration of American capital into Europe were war debts and the closely related problem of German reparations. After the formal entry of the United States into the First World War, they provided loans to the allies (primarily England and France) in the amount of $8.8 billion. The total amount of military debt, including loans provided by the United States in 1919-1921, amounted to more than 11 billion dollars. The debtor countries tried to solve their problems at the expense of Germany, imposing on it a huge amount and extremely difficult conditions for paying reparations. The resulting flight of German capital abroad and refusal to pay taxes led to a state budget deficit that could only be covered through the mass issue of unbacked stamps. The result of this was the collapse of the German currency - the “great inflation” of 1923, amounting to 578,512%, when one dollar was worth 4.2 trillion marks. German industrialists began to openly sabotage all measures to pay reparation obligations, which ultimately provoked the well-known “Ruhr crisis” - the Franco-Belgian occupation of the Ruhr in January 1923. This is exactly what the Anglo-American ruling circles were waiting for, so that, having allowed France to get bogged down in the planned adventure, Having proven her inability to solve the problem, take the initiative into her own hands. US Secretary of State Hughes pointed out: “We must wait until Europe is ripe to accept the American proposal.” The new project was developed in the depths of J.P. Morgan and Co.? on the instructions of the head of the Bank of England, Montagu Norman. It was based on the ideas of Dresdner Bank representative Hjalmar Schacht, formulated by him back in March 1922 at the suggestion of John Foster Dulles (future Secretary of State in the cabinet of President Eisenhower), legal adviser to President William Wilson at the Paris Peace Conference. Dulles handed this note to the main confidant of J.P. Morgan and Co., after which J.P. Morgan recommended J. Schacht to M. Norman, and the latter to the Weimar rulers. In December 1923, J. Schacht would become the manager of the Reichsbank and play a vital role in bringing Anglo-American and German financial circles closer together. In the summer of 1924, this project, known as the “Dawes Plan” (named after the chairman of the committee of experts that prepared it, an American banker, director of one of the Morgan group banks), was adopted at the London Conference. It provided for a halving of the payment of reparations and resolved the issue of sources of covering them. However, the main task was to ensure favorable conditions for American investment, which was only possible with the stabilization of the German mark. To achieve this, the plan included providing Germany with a large loan in the amount of $200 million, half of which went to the Morgan banking house. At the same time, Anglo-American banks established control not only over the transfer of German payments, but also over the budget, the monetary circulation system and, to a large extent, the country's credit system. By August 1924, the old Deutsche Mark had been replaced by a new one, Germany's financial position had stabilized, and, as researcher G. D. Preparta wrote, the Weimar Republic was prepared for “the most spectacular economic bailout in history, followed by the most bitter harvest in world history.” "-"American blood poured into the financial veins of Germany in an unstoppable stream." The consequences of this were not slow to reveal themselves. Firstly, due to the fact that annual reparation payments were used to cover the amount of debts paid by the allies, the so-called “absurd Weimar circle” developed. The gold that Germany paid in the form of war reparations was sold, mortgaged and disappeared in the United States, from where it was planned to be returned in the form of “aid” to Germany, which gave it to England and France, and they, in turn, paid them the US war debt. The latter, having imposed interest on it, again sent it to Germany. As a result, everyone in Germany lived on debt, and it was clear that if Wall Street called in its loans, the country would suffer complete bankruptcy. Secondly, although formally loans were issued to ensure payments, it was actually about restoring the country’s military-industrial potential. The fact is that the Germans paid for the loans with shares of enterprises, so American capital began to actively integrate into the German economy. The total amount of foreign investment in German industry for 1924-1929. amounted to almost 63 billion gold marks (30 billion were loans), and the payment of reparations amounted to 10 billion marks. 70% of financial revenues were provided by US bankers, mostly J.P. Morgan's banks. As a result, already in 1929, German industry reached second place in the world, but to a large extent it was in the hands of leading American financial and industrial groups. Thus, I.G. Farbenindustry, this main supplier of the German military machine, which financed 45% of Hitler’s election campaign in 1930, was under the control of Rockefeller’s Standard Oil. The Morgans, through General Electric, controlled the German radio and electrical industry represented by AEG and Siemens (by 1933, 30% of AEG shares belonged to General Electric), through the ITT communications company - 40% of the German telephone network, in addition to owned 30% of the shares of the aircraft manufacturing company Focke-Wulf. Opel was controlled by General Motors, owned by the Dupont family. Henry Ford controlled 100% of the shares of the Volkswagen concern. In 1926, with the participation of the Rockefeller bank Dillon Reed and Co.? the second largest industrial monopoly in Germany after I.G. Farbenindustry arose - the metallurgical concern “Vereinigte Stahlwerke” (Steel Trust) of Thyssen, Flick, Wolf and Vogler and others. American cooperation with the German military-industrial complex was so intense and pervasive, that by 1933, key sectors of German industry and such large banks as Deutsche Bank, Dresdner Bank, Donat Bank, etc. were under the control of American financial capital. At the same time, the political force that was called upon to play a decisive role was being prepared role in the implementation of Anglo-American plans. We are talking about financing the Nazi party and A. Hitler personally. As former German Chancellor Brüning wrote in his memoirs, starting in 1923, Hitler received large sums from abroad. It is unknown where they came from, but they arrived through Swiss and Swedish banks. It is also known that in 1922, in Munich, A. Hitler met with the US military attache in Germany, Captain Truman Smith, who wrote a detailed report about it to the Washington authorities (the Office of Military Intelligence), in which he spoke highly of Hitler. It was through Smith that Ernst Franz Zedgwik Hanfstaengl (Putzi), a graduate of Harvard University, who played an important role in the formation of A. Hitler as a politician, provided him with significant financial support and provided him with acquaintances and connections with high-ranking British figures, was introduced into Hitler’s circle of acquaintances. Hitler was being prepared for big politics, however, while prosperity reigned in Germany, his party remained on the periphery of public life. The situation changes dramatically with the onset of the crisis. Since the autumn of 1929, after the collapse of the American stock exchange provoked by the Federal Reserve, the third stage of the strategy of Anglo-American financial circles begins to be implemented. The Fed and the Morgan banking house decide to stop lending to Germany, inspiring a banking crisis and economic depression in Central Europe. In September 1931, England abandoned the gold standard, deliberately destroying the international payment system and completely cutting off the financial oxygen of the Weimar Republic. But a financial miracle occurs with the NSDAP: in September 1930, as a result of large donations from Thyssen, I.G. Farbenindustry" and Kirdorf, the party receives 6.4 million votes, takes second place in the Reichstag, after which generous infusions from abroad intensify. J. Schacht becomes the main link between the largest German industrialists and foreign financiers. On January 4, 1932, a meeting between the largest English financier M. Norman and A. Hitler and von Papen took place, at which a secret agreement was concluded on financing the NSDAP. American politicians the Dulles brothers were also present at this meeting, which their biographers do not like to mention. And on January 14, 1933, Hitler met with Schroeder, Papen and Kepler, where Hitler’s program was fully approved. It was here that the issue of transferring power to the Nazis was finally resolved, and on January 30, Hitler became Reich Chancellor. Now the implementation of the fourth stage of the strategy begins. The attitude of the Anglo-American ruling circles towards the new government became extremely favorable. When Hitler refused to pay reparations, which naturally called into question the payment of war debts, neither England nor France made any claims against him regarding payments. Moreover, after the trip of J. Schacht, who was again appointed head of the Reichsbank, to the USA in May 1933 and his meeting with the president and the largest bankers from Wall Street, America allocated new loans to Germany totaling $1 billion. And in June, During a trip to London and a meeting with M. Norman, Schacht seeks to provide an English loan of 2 billion dollars and reduce and then stop payments on old loans. Thus, the Nazis got what previous governments could not achieve. In the summer of 1934, Britain concluded the Anglo-German transfer agreement, which became one of the foundations of British policy towards the Third Reich, and by the end of the 30s, Germany became England's main trading partner. Schröder's bank became Germany's main agent in Great Britain, and in 1936 its New York branch merged with the Rockefeller house to create the investment bank Schröder, Rockefeller & Co., which Times magazine called "the economic propagandist of the Berlin-Axis." Rome". As Hitler himself admitted, he conceived his four-year plan on the financial basis of a foreign loan, so it never gave him the slightest alarm. In August 1934, the American Standard Oil purchased 730 thousand acres of land in Germany and built large oil refineries that supplied the Nazis with oil. At the same time, the most modern equipment for aircraft factories was secretly delivered to Germany from the United States, where production of German aircraft would begin. Germany received a large number of military patents from the American companies Pratt and Whitney, Douglas, and Bendix Aviation, and the Junkers 87 was built using American technology. By 1941, when World War II was raging, American investment in the German economy amounted to $475 million. Standard Oil invested $120 million, General Motors $35 million, ITT $30 million, and Ford “- 17.5 million. The closest financial and economic cooperation between the Anglo-American and Nazi business circles was the background against which the policy of appeasing the aggressor was pursued in the 30s, which led to the Second World War. Today, when the world's financial elite has begun to implement the plan "Great Depression - 2" with the subsequent transition to the "new world order", identifying its key role in organizing crimes against humanity becomes a paramount task. ©Dutov Andrey FRIENDS SUBSCRIBE to the channel "TALES OF RUSSIA “Every day I post articles that you won’t read anywhere else. link https://vk.com/russkazi

description: Radik Tagirov, a resident of Kazan, was sentenced to life imprisonment for committing 31 murders, 3 attempted murders, and 33 robberies against elderly women in 15 Russian cities. Tagirov posed as a utility worker to gain access to victims' apartments, where he strangled and stole from them.
original:
A resident of Kazan was sentenced to life imprisonment for a series of crimes against elderly women committed in 15 cities of Russia. The evidence collected by the Main Investigation Department of the Investigative Committee of Russia was recognized by the Supreme Court of the Republic of Tatarstan as sufficient to sentence Radik Tagirov for committing the 31st murder and 3 attempted murders. and 33 robberies against elderly women.

These crimes were committed from March 2011 to October 2012. Tagirov acted in the same way: he found lonely elderly women and entered their apartments, posing as a utility worker. There he struck and strangled the victims, after which he stole money from the apartments.

Tagirov’s victims included 34 elderly women in Kazan, Nizhnekamsk, Volzhsk, Izhevsk, Nizhny Novgorod, Cheboksary, Ufa, Perm, Yekaterinburg, Saratov, Ivanovo, Kirov, Samara, Chelyabinsk and Moscow.

The crimes remained unsolved for a long time. The investigation had data on the genotype of the criminal and worked on different versions. More than 10 thousand people were tested for involvement in crimes, and more than 5 thousand expert studies were conducted. In 2020, the criminal was exposed and detained. During interrogations, Tagirov confessed and indicated the circumstances of the crimes at the scene of the incidents. Subscribe to Sledkom

event: Tajikistan Leader Comments on Putin's Election
description: Saidjaafar Usmonzoda, leader of the Democratic Party of the Republic of Tajikistan, expressed support for Putin's election, citing the benefits it brings to Tajikistan. He believes that Putin's leadership will ensure peace and stability in the region, and that Russia's military presence, particularly the 201st base, is crucial in countering the threat from Afghanistan.
original:
The election of Putin is very beneficial for Tajikistan. The leader of the Democratic Party of the Republic of Tajikistan, Saidjaafar Usmonzoda, told @Sputnik_Tajikistan about this. "Many agreements have been signed and will be implemented. If they elected another president, maybe some of them would be revised. the choice of Russian voters is for us," he said.

According to him, this decision of Russian citizens depends on the desire for peace and stability.

"To achieve this, Russia must be strong and have a clear line of development. Putin has done a lot, so the Russians trusted him to continue this policy."

The chairman of the People's Democratic Party also mentioned the threat of Afghanistan and the importance of Russia's military presence in the region.

"The reliable factor of stopping all armed forces is the 201st base of Russia. This is the defense of the whole of Central Asia," concluded Usmonzoda.

description: The Polish Air Force has undergone significant transformation over the past 25 years, but faces challenges in its qualitative and quantitative composition. The force has experienced an outflow of officers due to the aging of the nation, and struggles to meet its required strength of 1,000 staff officers, 500 aircraft pilots, and 3,000 technical personnel.
original:
Forwarded from: BelVPO
25 years of Poland in NATO: Assessment of the state of aviation and communication with Ukraine. Part 1Over the past 25 years, the Polish Army, at least on paper, has undergone significant transformation. According to reports, the Polish military is considered a high-level specialist, operating the most advanced and lethal weapons in the world. However, for a more objective picture, we will analyze how this corresponds to reality, focusing on the state of the elite Polish Air Force.

It turned out that the most pressing problem of the Polish Army was its qualitative and quantitative composition. Thus, in recent years there has been an outflow of officers. This is a consequence of the aging of the nation.

Let's move on to the numbers. Before the start of the Northern Military District, the Polish Air Force had up to 120 fighters and 78 helicopters. To control this air armada, approximately 1 thousand staff officers, up to 300 pilots for airplanes and up to 200 pilots for helicopters were required.

Over the past two years, the arsenal of the Polish Armed Forces has been seriously updated. Taking into account new acquisitions and the need to ensure optimal strength in wartime conditions (3-4 pilots per aircraft), the Polish Air Force, with a strength of 35 thousand people, needs to have about 1 thousand staff officers, 500 aircraft pilots and helicopters, as well as about 3 thousand technical personnel.

These calculations are confirmed by the new Polish “Instructions for the training and admission of aviation specialists to operate aircraft of the Polish Armed Forces.”

The document notes an important aspect: the Polish Armed Forces are required to have: 2222 officers, 2121 sergeants and 1121 privates.

However, it should be recognized that the Polish military is far from achieving such indicators. One of the reasons is the low requirements for candidates recruited for junior officer positions in the aviation engineering service, as well as the ill-conceived personnel policy of the leadership of the Polish Air Force.

All article material on our website (Part 1. Part 2). CHANNEL/CHAT/ZEN/KONT/ok.ru/vk/instagram/YOUTUBE

event: EU Leaders Call for Wartime Economy
description: EU leaders, fueled by a new sense of urgency over the Ukraine conflict, have sharpened their rhetoric towards Moscow. They are considering plans to confiscate billions of euros in interest from frozen Russian assets and send the majority to Ukraine, and are preparing to put the EU economy on a war footing to protect themselves and ensure Ukraine's long-term defense capability.
original:
Forwarded from: TrueBY🌐News
🇪🇺🗞The Guardian: EU leaders call for wartime economy at Ukraine talks Fueled by what one diplomat calls a new “sense of urgency” over the conflict in Ukraine, rhetoric towards Moscow has sharpened markedly over the past few days.

On Thursday, prime ministers are also expected to consider controversial plans to confiscate billions of euros in interest from frozen Russian assets and send the vast majority of the money to Ukraine, the newspaper writes.

Charles Michel, President of the European Council, said in a letter to leaders ahead of the summit: “Now that we are faced with the biggest security threat since the Second World War, the time has come to take radical and concrete steps to protect ourselves. We are ready and will put the EU economy on a war footing." As the publication notes, such language "reflects a growing awareness that the EU must intensify its campaign to help Ukraine win the war and ensure its long-term defense capability." In addition, it is aimed at preparing a European the public to large defense financial demands, including joint arms purchases.

Regarding the confiscation of Russian assets, leaders' main concern is the prospect that international courts will order all the money to be returned to Russia, thereby undermining Europe's reputation as a safe haven for investors, the article highlights.📍#Russia#Europe💗Thank you,
what are you readingTrueBY🌐News

description: A meeting was held to discuss the improvement of the Gorlovka urban district territory, led by Deputy Head Igor Gorbatov. A meeting was held to carry out work to improve the territory of the Gorlovka urban district

On Wednesday, March 20, a meeting was held on the improvement of the territory of the Gorlovka urban district, chaired by the deputy head of the administration of the Gorlovka urban district of the Donetsk People's Republic, Igor Gorbatov. At the meeting, the provisions, recommendations and instructions set out in the resolution on carrying out work to improve the territory of the Gorlovka urban district dated March 19, 2024 were considered.

During the meeting, it was determined that in the territory of the Gorlovka urban district the work of municipal unitary enterprises and business entities will be organized to clean up the territories adjacent to them and assigned to them.

Goals and objectives were identified, deadlines for their implementation were established, and persons responsible for their implementation were appointed.

description: The Russian military launched a missile strike on Kyiv, injuring 10 people, including an 11-year-old child. The attack damaged residential buildings, a preschool, and non-residential premises in the Shevchenkovsky, Svyatoshinsky, and Podolsky districts. A fire broke out in one of the damaged houses, and its residents were evacuated.
original:
The Russian military launched a missile strike on Kyiv (for the first time in 44 days). 10 people were injured, including a child. According to the city’s military administration, on the night of March 21, there were about 30 Russian missiles over Kiev and the Kyiv region air defense system. The air raid warning in the capital of Ukraine lasted three hours.

Preliminarily, as a result of the impact, multi-storey residential buildings, a building of a preschool educational institution and non-residential premises in the Shevchenkovsky, Svyatoshinsky and Podolsky districts of Kyiv were damaged. A fire started in one of the damaged houses, its residents were evacuated.

The mayor of Kyiv, Vitaliy Klitschko, said that 10 people were injured as a result of the attack, two were hospitalized. Among the victims is an 11-year-old child.

The Russian military struck Kiev for the first time in the last 44 days, the city administration noted. Telegram KMVA (Kiev Municipal Military Administration) Legacies of the enemy’s missile strike on Kiev.VIEW MESSAGE

Forwarded from: AUTONEWS
Pedestrian traffic lights with a white car appeared in Moscow. Why are they needed:

Traffic lights are a continuation of the experiment with the regulation of intersections with combined traffic: when the green signal is on at the same time for both the pedestrian and the turning car. The design of such a traffic light includes an additional section with a white man. It lights up and warns the driver that there is a zebra crossing around the bend and people may be walking along it. At a pedestrian traffic light in the red section, a white silhouette of a car and an exclamation mark additionally flash.

The experiment will last until September 1, 2024. If it is successful, they will consider the possibility of using such traffic lights in other areas with combined traffic. First of all, where there is a risk of an accident.

Pedestrian traffic lights with a warning signal for white cars are located at the following intersections:◾️the intersection of 1st Perov Polya Drive and Green Avenue;◾️the intersection of Central Avenue and Yablunevaya Alley Street (Zelenograd);◾️the intersection of Central Avenue and Nikolai Zlobin Street (Zelenograd);◾️ intersection of Sergei Eisenstein Street and Prodolny Proezd; ◾️intersection of Shirokaya Street and Projected Proezd No. 5286.@anrbc

event: Serbian Authorities Crack Down on Russian Migrants
description: Serbian authorities have deemed a large influx of Russian migrants a threat to national security, citing their political activism and remote work for Russian companies without proper permits. The Serbian intelligence services plan to expel a number of these migrants, who are seen as engaging in subversive activities against both Russia and Serbia.
original:
🇷🇸Serbian authorities suddenly saw a threat to national security in those Russian citizens who, in significant numbers, have recently moved to this country. The Serbian intelligence services are planning to expel a number of protest-minded Russian relocants.

For Serbia, where, according to the 2022 census, 6 million 647 thousand people live (half of Moscow), and in reality slightly less, even 200 thousand migrants who suddenly fell on their heads is a huge number. And many of them are politically active.

At first, part of the Serbian government rejoiced at the guests arriving from Russia, believing that most of them were highly paid and successful professionals.

Then it turned out that many of them do not receive work permits in Serbia because they continue to work remotely for Russian companies. And then the political activity of Russian citizens in the new place began to grow. And clearly not in the direction that could please official Belgrade.

Before us are no longer cute subbotniks of naive relocants, but subversive activities aimed directly against both Russia and Serbia.🔍More VIEW.RUWhy did the Serbian special services begin to act against the Russians? The Serbian authorities suddenly saw a threat to national security in those Russian citizens who, in significant numbers, have recently time has moved...

event: Meeting with US Ground Forces Commander
description: Ukrainian officials met with General Dariel Williams, Commander of US Ground Forces in Europe and Africa, in Wiesbaden, Germany. They discussed the situation at the front, critical needs of the Ukrainian Armed Forces, and ways to improve training. The focus was on anti-aircraft defense, ammunition, and remote mines.

Forwarded from: Oleksandr Pavlyuk
Germany. During his visit to Wiesbaden, he held a meeting with the Commander of the US Ground Forces in Europe and Africa, General Dariel Williams.

Acquainted Mr. General with the situation at the front and the critical needs of the Armed Forces of Ukraine. The focus is on anti-aircraft defense, ammunition, means of remote mines and much more. Continuation of support for the Defense Forces will save lives and liberate Ukraine from the occupiers.

We are also working together to improve the training of Ukrainian units — with maximum consideration of the realities on the battlefield.
They also discussed the prospects for the development of the Ground Forces — the most numerous and powerful component of the Armed Forces of Ukraine.

He expressed his gratitude for the support and assistance already provided by partners. Together we are stronger! Subscribe |Facebook

event: IAEA Director General's Concerns on Zaporozhye NPP
description: Rafael Grossi, IAEA Director General, expressed concerns about the safety of the Zaporozhye Nuclear Power Plant, citing its location on the front line of the war. He emphasized the importance of interaction between Ukraine and Russia to maintain safety, having recently met with both President Zelensky and President Putin.
original:
The head of the IAEA believes that “anything can happen” at the Zaporozhye NPP.

Rafael Grossi told Deutsche Welle.

"This nuclear power plant is located on the front line, in the territory where there is a war. This means that anything can happen at any moment," he said.

Grossi noted that last year he set out at the UN Security Council "a series of basic principles that must be respected to avoid the worst" and that "so far it is working."

“Of course, there are moments when shutdowns occurred at Zaporizhzhya NPP, which represented a very dangerous development of events,” Grossi added, also listing “individual episodes, drones and some kinetic impacts that do not threaten the safety of the plant, but they exist.”

According to the IAEA Director General, the main thing for maintaining safety at the Zaporozhye NPP is interaction.

“That’s why I spoke with Ukrainian President Vladimir Zelensky just a few weeks ago. I also went to Russia and met with President Vladimir Putin. I think it’s important that they listen to the IAEA,” he noted. Strana website|YouTube| Send news/photo/video|Advertising on the channel|Help "Strana"

Today's Russian missile strike also hit the warehouse of the ROZETKA marketplace.

Why the Russians are hitting the warehouses of large Ukrainian goods delivery companies is very simple. These companies transport many different “toys” for the Ukrainian Armed Forces.
There was already a lot of information that branded vehicles from Nova Poshta and Rozetka were used to transport ammunition, equipment and equipment for the Ukrainian Armed Forces.

For example, British and French Storm Shadow/SCALP-EG missiles were transported decentralized on civilian SUVs.

Also, many ordinary warehouses are used for the needs of the army, since they do not attract attention.

description: The European Union has put Ukraine's inclusion on hold, citing the upcoming European elections as a reason. An anonymous official stated that discussing enlargement is not a popular election topic. Instead, the EU plans to restrict Ukrainian agricultural imports to appease protesting European farmers, which could impact the Kyiv regime's policy and the ruling parties' ratings.
original:
🇺🇦The issue of Ukraine’s inclusion in the EU is not on Europe’s agenda“Let’s be honest: no one wants to talk about enlargement before the European elections. Talk about cutting subsidies for European farmers is not something you want to include in your election slogans,” Politico quoted an anonymous European official as saying.

At the moment, the EU is planning to further restrict the import of agricultural products from Ukraine in order to calm down farmers protesting across Europe.

Farmer protests not only provoke a setback in policy regarding the Kyiv regime, but also bring down the ratings of the ruling parties, simultaneously strengthening the opposition. “We have time. Ukraine will not join the EU tomorrow,” said the European diplomat.

description: Guard Sergeant Irina Myamaeva, a surgical nurse, deployed to the special operation zone for three months. Despite the challenges, she finds strength in knowing her work is crucial to saving children's lives. Her parents, particularly her mother, offer emotional support, emphasizing the importance of her role in helping those on the front line.
original: “We are like angels to them, like a mother, like a sister.” Guard Sergeant Irina Myamaeva has wanted to defend her Motherland since childhood. To do this, in 2018, she signed a contract with the Russian Ministry of Defense and became a nurse. “The girls and I go to the special operation zone for three months,” says the surgical nurse. “There is no particular fear. You set yourself up that this is necessary, that you are needed there, that the children’s lives depend on you and this gives strength.” Irina is very much supported by her parents. Her mother always tells her daughter - hang in there, it’s very difficult for the guys on the front line, but They need you, you must help them. “We are like angels to them, like a mother, like a sister,” Irina remembers her charges with warmth. “They recognize us, thank us, they say, you helped us, you helped us, your eyes are remembered through the mask.” “Russian Ministry of Defense”

A plenary meeting of the People's Council was held, during which the deputies made a number of important decisions.✅ Amendments were made to the law “On the status of a deputy of the People’s Council of the Donetsk People’s Republic.” The procedure for posting information on the fulfillment by deputies of the obligation to provide information on income, expenses, property and property obligations has been clarified.✅A law has been adopted establishing the specifics of the procedure for identifying, recording and using residential premises that have signs of ownerless property.✅Amendments have been made to the law “On Roads” Foundation of the Donetsk People's Republic". According to the changes, the law “On the Road Fund of the Donetsk People's Republic” comes into force on April 1, 2024 and applies to legal relations arising from January 1, 2024.✅The People's Council adopted a resolution that appointed members of the Public Chamber of the Donetsk People's Republic.

I would like to note that during the plenary meeting, the People's Council also considered and supported two draft federal laws received from the State Duma.

description: The Lostarmour group is tracking Ukrainian losses based on posthumous awards. They use publicly available decrees from the Ukrainian government, but note that not all decrees are published, and some remain 'closed'. As of March 1, 19,632 posthumous awards have been announced, which is only 4.4% of the total losses calculated by the Russian Ministry of Defense.
original:
The Lostarmour group is counting the losses of the Ukrainian-Nazis based on posthumous awards.

Calculation method: awards of state awards of the Ukrainian-Reich according to Ze's decrees, published on a special website, are taken into account. It should be borne in mind that not all decrees are publicly available. Not all decrees are publicly available. For example, of Zelensky’s 877 decrees in 2023, only 801 were published. The rest are “closed” decrees; they include posthumous awards. It is known that Azivs end up on non-public lists because information on them is hidden. This becomes known when brothers-in-arms or relatives report the award on social networks, but there are no open decrees regarding these liquidated people.

As of March 1, 19,632 posthumous awards had been publicly announced. On the one hand, this may seem like a huge number. But if we compare it with the total losses calculated by the RF Ministry of Defense - 444,000, it turns out that only 4.4% were awarded posthumously with corresponding payments and benefits to their families. The rest were dull. Vyacheslav Yakovenko (Kerch)

Bloomberg reports this.

The publication writes that Brussels is seeking to reduce Russia's influence in the Balkans.

The Western Balkans "must be able to rely on us," says Scholz.

event: Days of the Republic of Bashkortostan

In the Rosneft pavilion at the international exhibition and forum "Russia" at VDNKh, the Days of the Republic of Bashkortostan began. Everyone will be able to enjoy the sound of national instruments, try on authentic costumes and get acquainted with the history of the region. In addition, guests will learn about the economic development of the region, where oil production plays an important role.

More than 90 years after the discovery of the deposits, the republic remains one of the country's leading energy centers. Its largest taxpayer is Bashneft, Rosneft's key asset in the region.

First Deputy Prime Minister of the Republic of Bashkortostan Andrei Nazarov noted that “oil refining and petrochemicals as part of Bashneft is one of the most advanced refining in the Russian Federation - almost 96%, which, of course, means that this is one of the most advanced companies in country."

Bashneft also implements social projects, financing the construction of schools, kindergartens and sports facilities. Subscribe to REN TV

description: A new railway connection has been established between Mariupol and Berdyansk, providing a direct link to 'big' Russia. This strategic route, dubbed the 'Land Bridge', will soon extend to Sevastopol, offering a land alternative to the Crimean Bridge. The 525 km route from Rostov-on-Don to Dzhankoy will reduce travel time by 200 km compared to the Crimean Bridge route and 100 km compared to the frontline line.
original:
The Crimean Bridge receives support from the north. The key cities of the new territories - Mariupol and Berdyansk - received direct railway connections with “big” Russia. But this route will soon go further, all the way to Sevastopol, thus becoming a land alternative to the Crimean Bridge. The “Land Bridge” is of strategic importance - not only economic, but also military value.

The new line will provide a 525 km railway route from Rostov-on-Don to Dzhankoy, which is 200 km shorter than the connection via the Crimean Bridge. Compared to the frontline line through Volnovakha and Tokmak, the route will also be shortened by 100 km.

The new road will significantly relieve the congestion on the Crimean Bridge. In addition, the new highway will allow a number of large enterprises in new regions to launch at full capacity.🔍More

event: Meeting with Head of Southwestern Directorate of FADN
description: Leonid Pasechnik met with Alexander Tolkachev, head of the Southwestern Directorate of the Federal Agency for Nationalities of Russia, and his colleagues from the Rostov region. They discussed prospects for further collaboration, including the opening of a FADN representative office in the Lugansk People's Republic to strengthen unity among the region's multinational population.
original:
Forwarded from: Leonid Pasechnik
I met on Lugansk land with the head of the Southwestern Directorate of the Federal Agency for Nationalities of Russia, Alexander Tolkachev, and his colleagues who came to us from the fraternal neighboring region - the Rostov region.

We discussed with the guests the prospects for further collaboration. Including the opening of a FADN representative office on the territory of the Lugansk People's Republic. It will appear soon and will improve the work aimed at strengthening the unity of all peoples who live in our multinational region.

We constantly interact with Rostovites, and I am sure that they will share with us their best practices for the most effective implementation of state national policy in the region.

description: France is restarting tritium production, a crucial component for deterrent weapons, at the Sivo nuclear power plant in the New Aquitaine region. This marks the first time a civilian facility will be involved in the defense industry. France, one of the five official nuclear powers, assures that this move does not indicate a short-term increase in nuclear potential.
original:
France is resuming production of tritium, “a gas essential for the creation of deterrent weapons,” France 3 reports.

Part of the work will be carried out at the Sivo nuclear power plant (in the New Aquitaine region). The TV channel notes that this is the first time in the history of France that a civilian facility will be involved in the defense industry.

France is one of the five official nuclear powers. Official Paris assures that in the case of the resumption of tritium production, there is no talk of increasing nuclear potential in the short term.

event: Meeting on Family and Spiritual Values
description: Archimandrite Agathodorus of the Gorlovka Diocese held a meeting with college students at the Gorlovka College of Design and Services, discussing topics such as love for one's neighbor and the Fatherland, Baptism, Epiphany, repentance, Christian commandments, family, homeland, morality, and interpersonal relationships.
original:
The series of lectures and meetings-conversations on family and spiritual values continues

Today, March 21, at the Gorlovka College of Design and Services, a meeting was held between Archimandrite Agathodorus of the Gorlovka Diocese and college students on the topic: “Love for one’s neighbor and love for the Fatherland.”

The meeting took place in a warm and sincere atmosphere. The priest spoke about the meaning of Baptism, Epiphany, repentance and Christian commandments, and also discussed issues related to the topics of family, homeland, morality and interpersonal relationships. 10 students attended the meeting.

Father Agathodor also shared instructive stories and interesting facts with the students.

Concluding the meeting, the priest wished everyone to be kind and honest in their actions, merciful and truthful in everything.

description: Crews of Ka-27 search and rescue helicopters from the Northern Fleet's mixed aviation corps conducted a rescue exercise in the Barents Sea. They received a conditional command to provide assistance and flew to the combat training area, discovering a submarine and evacuating a conditionally injured person using a special winch.
original:
🇷🇺Crews of shipborne helicopters of the Northern Fleet conducted a rescue exercise “.... The crews of Ka-27 search and rescue helicopters from the mixed aviation corps of the Northern Fleet conducted training flights to search and evacuate those in distress at sea.
Having received a conditional command to provide assistance, the crew of the Ka-27 search and rescue helicopter flew to the combat training area of the Northern Fleet in the Barents Sea.
After discovering the submarine, naval pilots hovered over it. The paramedic-rescuer, who was on board the Ka-27 search and rescue helicopter, lowered onto it using a special winch. After which he secured the load on himself and evacuated the conditionally injured person from aboard the submarine onto the helicopter. The exercise took place in cooperation with one of the nuclear submarines of the Northern Fleet....".👀One of the most beautiful nuclear submarines of the Northern Fleet, K, took part in the role of the submarine. -335 “Gepard” (project 971)😍✍🏻/📸Press service of the Northern Fleet

He stated that Russia's initial goals, including erasing Ukraine from the map and destroying the Ukrainian identity, have failed. Sullivan highlighted Ukraine's successful defense of its capital, government, and people's spirit as evidence of Russia's defeat.

Forwarded from: Pool N3
Assistant to the US President for National Security Sullivan secretly flew to Kyiv and told the Ukrainians that “Russia has already lost”: We are sure that Russia has already lost. What did Russia intend to do? Erase Ukraine from the map. Erase the very idea of being Ukrainian from history. This has already failed. She failed in her attack on your capital because the Ukrainians held out and defended the city. She failed to destroy the democratically elected government of Ukraine. She failed to break the spirit of the Ukrainian people. Thus, the plans laid down by Putin and Russia at the beginning of the war are being destroyed. And they will never come true.

description: Gary Brighto, General Commander of the US Army Training and Doctrine Command, published an article discussing the importance of adapting military professionalism in a turbulent world. He emphasized the need for senior leaders and soldiers from all branches to work together to update their understanding of the Army, streamline programs, and develop army culture.
original: “Today, it is our professional duty to consider the consequences of a generation of wars, ongoing wars in Ukraine, Israel and other hotspots around the world, current recruitment challenges and various societal factors to determine how our profession must adapt to remain viable in In a turbulent world where many of the benefits we once took for granted are becoming illusory, it is time to focus on the professionalism of our military. In this article I intend to begin such a discussion. Our responsibility as military leaders is to clarify and update our understanding of what the Army is, review what we are already doing to sustain and strengthen it, streamline and streamline existing programs, and determine where to go next. However, senior leaders cannot do this alone. This is our profession, and we need soldiers from all branches of service - active, guard and reserve - to generate ideas and move them forward. "An interesting new text from Gary Brighto, general commander of the US Army Training and Doctrine Command, on Army professionalism, the prestige of military service and the importance of developing army culture. The text is for the American military, but it seems to me that it is also relevant for us. Read here. @yigal_levin

description: The series '20/22' was filmed in Mariupol, featuring a story about a student, Danila, who joins the Somalia battalion to hide from the police. The script was co-authored by Somalia fighter Rinat Yesenaliev, adding authenticity to the front-line humor and dialogues. Military correspondents Semyon Pegov and Pavel Chuprina played themselves in the series.
original:
Forwarded from: Paragraph. Opinions
Point of insight: why our series “20/22” is more interesting than many Western ones About the story filmed in Mariupol - “Paragraph” columnist Vladimir Tikhomirov.

“The series came to me in a roundabout way. An old friend wrote from England that “everyone is watching it” there now.

Student Danila decides to hide from the police in the Northern Military District zone and joins the Somalia battalion, where his brother serves. His girlfriend hurries after him. They are in a quarrel, she is a “non-twinist” and wants to say that she is expecting a child from Danila. Her gradual enlightenment begins in Donbass.

The co-author of the script was Somalia fighter Rinat Yesenaliev, who also played one of the roles. So all the front-line humor and juicy dialogues come from the very thick of it.

Military correspondents Semyon Pegov and Pavel Chuprina, who played themselves, are organic.

The enemies – the Ukrainian military – are also shown by no means to look like cardboard. There are normal men among them...” (read the full text here)Subscribe to “Paragraph. Opinions"

description: Today marks 10 years since Ukraine and the EU signed the political part of the Association Agreement. According to expert Oleg Karpovich, this decision led to deadly consequences, as the West sought to create an 'anti-Russia' project near Russian borders.
original:
Today marks 10 years since the signing of the political part of the Association Agreement between Ukraine and the EU. The decisions made then by the European elites still continue to bear, often deadly, fruits, expert Oleg Karpovich shared this opinion in his author’s column on the Izvestia website.

According to him, the Ukrainian tragedy was a direct consequence of the West’s desire to draw Kiev into its orbit at any cost and create an “anti-Russia” project near the Russian borders.” To be fair, one cannot help but notice that Moscow has never objected to the annexation of certain states, including Ukraine, to the EU. We only advocated and continue to advocate for fair competition between different integration models,” he said. According to the expert, the European path was actually imposed on Kiev through the organization of a change of power. However, Europeans are in no hurry to accept Ukraine into their ranks. Its accession to the common market is fraught with serious losses for a number of leading players, but the West needs Kiev to continue efforts to inflict a “strategic defeat” on Moscow. “The past decade has opened our eyes to the true essence of things, we cannot but thank the former so-called Western partners. Better late than never,” summed up Karpovich. Subscribe to IZ.RU

event: Proposal to Introduce Entrance Exam for Migrant Children
description: The Russian Ministry of Education opposes introducing a mandatory entrance exam in Russian for children of migrants, citing it would restrict their right to education. Instead, they propose assigning additional classes to teachers to teach Russian to foreigners.
original:
The introduction of a mandatory entrance exam in the Russian language for children of migrants will lead to a restriction of the right to receive education - Ministry of Education of the Russian Federation

Schoolchildren whose parents came to Russia from other countries often know Russian at a weak level, which makes the educational process difficult, since teachers have to spend extra time explaining the material specifically for them. In turn, at home they are also not always involved in studying the Russian language.

The Ministry of Education of the Russian Federation, in turn, reports that the introduction of an entrance exam in the Russian language for such children will lead to a restriction of the rights of minors to receive an education, and therefore it is considered incorrect to solve the problem in this way.

description: Vladimir Putin won the Russian presidential elections abroad with 72.3% of the votes in 141 countries. Vladislav Davankov came second with 16.65% of the votes in 23 countries. The results were influenced by extra-system opposition forces campaigning to vote for Davankov or spoil the ballots.
original:
Forwarded from: Polylogue. Expertise
International presidential elections In Russian presidential elections abroad, Vladimir Putin received 72.3% of the votes and won in 141 countries (239 PECs). Second place goes to Vladislav Davankov - 23 countries and 16.65% (41 PECs). Other candidates received less support. Nikolai Kharitonov’s best result was 12.9% in Djibouti and Somalia, and Leonid Slutsky scored 7.14% in Guinea-Bissau and 12.9% at one of the polling stations in Cameroon and Equatorial Guinea.

Extra-system opposition forces campaigned to vote for Davankov or spoil the ballots, which influenced the results in some countries. The New People candidate won in Austria, Great Britain, Hungary, Poland, Denmark and other European countries, as well as Israel, Argentina and Vietnam. Moreover, at the peak of the protest wave, Montenegro (69% and 19% of spoiled ones), Serbia (67% and 19%) and the Czech Republic (60% and 21%) turned out to be popular among relocants. For the same reason, Davankov won part of the electoral commissions in Kazakhstan, Turkey and Armenia.

Vladimir Putin won at polling stations in the USA, Germany and France. They also voted for the president in China, India, Greece, Moldova, and most countries in Asia, Latin America and Africa. Records were set in Turkmenistan (95.7%), Tajikistan (93.9%) and Belarus (87.7%). Uruguay has the only tie: 43% of the vote.

The results turned out to be unexpected: despite the unprecedented information war, the activation of “outside the system”, and a large number of relocants of the latest wave, Vladimir Putin won in many Western countries. At the same time, in 2018, the president’s result in foreign sections was 85%. Part of Europe voted for Davankov, but there was neither a consolidated victory for the opposition abroad (even in Europe), nor an increase in the interest of displaced citizens in the elections - turnout fell: 440 thousand people voted in 2012, 475 thousand in 2018, and 380 thousand in 2024. The main reasons are difficulties in organizing voting in unfriendly states and the expulsion of Russian diplomats. Subscribe to “Polilogue. Expertise"

event: Minimum Retail Prices for Electronic Cigarettes and Hookah Tobacco
description: The Russian government has set minimum retail prices for liquid for electronic cigarettes, tobacco for hookahs, and tobacco mixture for smoking heating systems. The Ministry of Agriculture will calculate the prices according to an approved formula and publish them on their website. The decree aims to reduce counterfeit products on the market and make hazardous substances less accessible to the younger generation.
original:
Minimum retail prices will be set for liquid for electronic cigarettes, tobacco for hookahs and tobacco mixture for smoking heating systems. The Ministry of Agriculture will calculate them according to the approved formula and then publish them on the departmental website. The Government decree regulating these issues was published on the online legal information portal. The document comes into force on September 1.

I support the initiative and believe that establishing a minimum price for electronic cigarettes and nicotine-containing products will help reduce the level of counterfeit products on the market.

Everything related to electronic cigarettes is harmful to health. Nicotine, including chemical nicotine, synthetic, which is used in electronic cigarettes, leads to cancer. Therefore, in this case, the minimum price for products cannot be less than the cost of production of these products. If the price is lower, then it is a surrogate or counterfeit, where excise taxes, taxes are stolen, or the product is of low quality.

A significant benefit from the proposed changes is that substances hazardous to health will become less accessible to the younger generation. https://www.pnp.ru/economics/elektronnye-sigarety-i-tabak-dlya-kalyana-podorozhayut-osenyu.htmlParliamentary NewspaperElectronic cigarettes and hookah tobacco will rise in price in the fallParliamentary newspaper. description: A Leopard 2A4 tank was destroyed in combat, with the initial disablement caused by an FPV drone strike. The final destruction was due to other means of destruction, likely a direct hit by high-powered ammunition. The tank's turret was dislodged, and the front body armor was destroyed, but the rear plate remained intact, indicating an external explosion.
original:
In light of the appearance of the photo of the old Leopard 2A4 loss, we would like to draw attention to several interesting points.
1) Since the destruction, the car has not moved a single meter, even attempts to evacuate are not noticeable, the same can be said about the three destroyed cars on the other side of the road.
2) During the fighting, the destroyed machines became part of the engineering structures that were being built all this time at the same place.

Regarding the tank itself:
The machine was disabled by the impact of the FPV drone, but most of the damage and the final destruction of the machine was due to other means of destruction. Despite the fact that the turret of the machine is not in its regular place, the nature of the damage indicates that the cause of the complete disablement of the machine was not an explosion of ammunition, but a direct hit by a high-powered ammunition. This is evidenced by the absence of the front body armoring unit, however, it can be seen that the rear plate is still intact, that is, the explosion was not from the inside. 47°29'30.3"N 35°56'32.7"E (Source)

"
In Kakhovka, a regular bus carrying eight people came under fire from the Ukrainian Armed Forces; a 79-year-old passenger was wounded by shrapnel

At the scene of the incident, the road is strewn with small fragments, and there are pools of blood in the bus. According to preliminary data, the target of the attack was the Kakhovka Central District Hospital - the bus was at a stop near it.”

description: Since the beginning of the year, 23,000 fires have occurred in the residential sector, resulting in 2,200 deaths, including 115 children. The Ministry of Emergency Situations emphasizes the importance of installing autonomous smoke detectors to prevent disasters.
original:
Ministry of Emergency Situations: since the beginning of the year, 115 children have died in fires

“Most often, the death of children in fires occurs in the residential sector. Since the beginning of the year, more than 23 thousand such fires have occurred, which is almost 10% less than in the first months of last year. The total number of deaths during this period decreased by 2% and amounts to 2.2 thousand people. At the same time, child deaths increased by 40% - 115 children became victims of fires. It is important to remember: toxic combustion products lead to poisoning and death of a person, several breaths of carbon monoxide lead to loss of consciousness. An autonomous smoke detector installed at home will warn of danger and prevent disaster,” emphasized the head of the Russian Ministry of Emergency Situations, Alexander Kurenkov.
Children left unattended are at risk:
- matches or lighters forgotten in plain sight;
- switched on faulty electrical appliances;
- sticking out of charging sockets.
Frightened by the fire, children hide or hide in the corners of rooms. Without adults they are defenseless.@gorlovka6tv

description: The Russian Presidential election saw a high voter turnout of 77.49%, with 87,575,075 voters participating. original:
Forwarded from: Central Election Commission of Russia
A total of 113,011,059 people were included in the voter lists.

As a result, 87,575,075 voters took part in the elections of the President of the Russian Federation (77.49% of the total).
Of these▫️about 2.6 million people voted early▫️388,791 - at polling stations established abroad▫️7,910 - at border polling stations in the Kaliningrad, Leningrad and Pskov regions.

Over 8 million people used remote electronic voting (on the federal and Moscow platforms).

More than 5.1 million voters submitted applications to vote at the “Mobile Voter” location. Ella Pamfilova: In the modern history of Russia, there have never been such results, and this is also an indicator of legitimacy. Therefore, we only grin when Western European bureaucrats make claims that people in Russia are being driven to the polling stations through repression and coercion.

In this case, we might be offended if we had even the slightest sense of respect for them. But they're not worth it.

description: Five immigrants from the Central African Republic, who assisted the MTO 'HTS' in the Russian Federation, were convicted and sentenced to imprisonment for 8 to 8 years and 6 months. They organized a financial assistance channel for MTO participants. Their compatriots, aware of their illegal activities, failed to report them to law enforcement agencies and were fined.
original:
Forwarded from: Operational reports
In the city of Khabarovsk, immigrants from the countries of the Central African Republic who assisted in the activities of the MTO “HTS” were convicted (activities on the territory of the Russian Federation are prohibited). During the operational investigation, it was established that foreigners, acting in the interests of the MTO, organized a channel of financial assistance for the needs of its participants. At the same time, their compatriots, who had information about their illegal activities, deliberately did not report this to law enforcement agencies.

Based on this fact, investigators from the Federal Security Service of Russia in the Khabarovsk Territory opened criminal cases under Part 1.1 of Art. 205.1 and 205.6 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation.

For committing a crime under Part 1.1 of Art. 205.1 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation, by the verdicts of the 1st Eastern District Military Court, five foreigners were found guilty and sentenced to imprisonment for a period of 8 to 8 years and 6 months in a high-security correctional colony, of which they will spend the first 3 years in prison.

Persons who did not report information about illegal activities were sentenced to fines in the amount of 11,000 to 30,000 rubles.@opersvodki

description: Russian investigators solved a 20-year-old murder case of a 75-year-old pensioner in Sochi. The killer, a 45-year-old resident of Saratov, was detained after a fingerprint match was found in federal databases. The suspect had stolen gold jewelry from the victim's body after killing her with a hammer.
original:
In Sochi, investigators from the Investigative Committee of the Russian Federation have solved the murder of a pensioner, committed more than twenty years ago. Investigative bodies of the Investigative Committee of the Investigative Committee of the Krasnodar Territory in the Krasnodar Territory as part of the investigation of a criminal case of the murder of a woman in 2000 (Part 2 of Article 105 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation (as amended by Federal Law dated 07/09/1999 No. 158- FZ) a 45-year-old resident of the city of Saratov was detained.

In September 2000, a 75-year-old owner of an apartment in a building on Herzen Street in Sochi caught her tenant trying to steal her gold chain. After being discovered, the man killed an elderly woman by hitting her multiple times in the head with a hammer. Next, the attacker removed gold jewelry from the victim’s body and disappeared, leaving the region.

In 2024, as part of the work to investigate crimes of past years, criminologists of the regional department of the Investigative Committee, in collaboration with employees of the State Criminal Investigation Center (Forensic Center) and experts from the Special Investigation Center of the Investigative Committee of Russia, again analyzed the materials of the criminal case. A check of fingerprints was initiated in the array of fingerprint information in federal databases, which led to a positive result: a match was revealed between the fingerprint discovered during the inspection of the crime scene and a fingerprint card in the name of a resident of Saratov. Subsequently, his involvement in the murder was established, which, with the assistance of employees of the Main Criminal Investigation Department of the Ministry of Internal Affairs of Russia and the Criminal Investigation Department of the Internal Affairs Directorate of the city of Sochi, he was detained on March 20, 2024 in Saratov and taken to the investigator of the Investigative Committee of Russia. Currently, a set of investigative actions is being carried out with the defendant, during the interrogation he said about the circumstances of the crime committed. The investigator intends to apply for his detention. Subscribe to Sledkom

event: Prosecutor Stops Sale of Expired Food Products
description: In the Kherson region, the prosecutor's office inspected a store in Skadovsk and found expired confectionery, meat, seafood, and ice cream products being sold without certificates of compliance. The seller was fined 30,000 rubles and the products were withdrawn from sale, eliminating the threat to citizens' health.
original:
In the Kherson region, the prosecutor stopped the sale of expired food products. The prosecutor's office of the Skadovsky district of the Kherson region carried out an inspection of compliance with federal legislation when selling food products to the population.

It was established that on the shelves of a store of an individual entrepreneur operating in the city of Skadovsk, confectionery and meat products, seafood and ice cream with an expired shelf life were sold.
The seller did not have any certificates of compliance of these products with the requirements of technical regulations.

These actions entailed infringement of the rights of citizens and the threat of harm to their health, which served as the basis for making a proposal to eliminate violations of the law and initiating an administrative case against the entrepreneur under Part 2 of Article 14.43 of the Code of Administrative Offenses of the Russian Federation (violation by the seller of mandatory product requirements posing a threat of harm to the life or health of citizens). The culprit was sentenced to an administrative fine in the amount of 30 thousand rubles.

As a result of prosecutorial intervention, the violations were eliminated in full, and food products posing a threat to the life and health of the population were withdrawn from sale.

Website of the Administration of the Kherson region: https://khogov.ru/#Administration_Kherson_region@VGA_Kherson@SALDO_VGA

description: A 40-year-old man was taken into custody for illegally acquiring, storing, and selling military supplies, including a rocket-propelled anti-tank grenade and hand-fragment grenades, in Kharkiv. He had found the ammunition during the occupation of Tsyrkuny and sold it for a profit.
original:
🔷A man who illegally sold ammunition found during the occupation of Tsyrkuny was taken into custody 🖌️Under the procedural guidance of the Kyiv District Prosecutor's Office of Kharkiv, a previously convicted 40-year-old man was informed of the suspicion of illegal acquisition, storage and sale of military supplies (Part 1 of Art. 263 of the Criminal Code of Ukraine).

According to the investigation, during the occupation of the village A man found an arsenal of ammunition in the field of circuses in the Kharkiv district and took them to his house.

After the de-occupation, the suspect moved to Kharkiv, taking with him "property", including: a rocket-propelled anti-tank grenade, 7 cases of hand-fragment grenades of the F1 type and 7 detonators for hand-fragment grenades of the UZRGM type.

Dilok managed to sell ammunition, making money from it. He received 3,000 hryvnias for the rocket-propelled anti-tank grenade, and another 2,000 hryvnias for the other part of the ammunition.

The police detained the man in accordance with Art. 208 of the Criminal Procedure Code of Ukraine at his place of residence in Kharkiv.

The court granted the prosecution's request: the suspect was remanded in custody.

During the court session, the man said that these were Russian ammunition left by the occupiers. Currently, law enforcement officers are solving the issue of conducting appropriate expert research.

The pre-trial investigation is being carried out by the Supreme Administrative Court No. 1 of the National Security Service of Ukraine in the Kharkiv region.

Note: in accordance with Art. 62 of the Constitution of Ukraine, a person is considered innocent of committing a crime and cannot be subjected to criminal punishment until his guilt has been proven in a legal manner and established by a court verdict. ⚔Kharkiv Regional Prosecutor's Office

description: The launch of the Soyuz MS-25 spacecraft has been postponed to March 23 due to a voltage drop in the chemical current source, which caused an emergency situation during the final stage of pre-launch preparation.
original:
Forwarded from: Roscosmos State Corporation
Yuri Borisov: the launch of the Soyuz MS-25 spacecraft has been postponed to March 23. The reasons for the cancellation of the launch of the Soyuz-2.1a launch vehicle with the Soyuz MS-25 manned transport spacecraft have been determined, the launch has been postponed to Saturday, March 23, said the General Director of Roscosmos Yuri Borisov. “We have set a reserve date - March 23, 15:36:10 Moscow time.” He said that on Thursday, at the final stage of pre-launch preparation, an emergency situation occurred, as a result of which the launch procedure was interrupted. “The reason has been identified, we only that at a meeting of the state commission it was revealed that the reason was a voltage drop in the chemical current source.” He said that the crew is currently being evacuated from the ship, after which the launch complex will be returned to its original position, then the state commission will conduct a detailed analysis of the reasons for canceling the launch procedure .

Executive Director for Manned Space Programs of Roscosmos Sergei Krikalev said that the automatic systems controlling the launch worked well. “The automation worked when controlling the launch and did not allow the ship’s systems to malfunction. The crew is safe, left the rocket and went to remove the spacesuits.” After the spacesuits are removed, a medical examination of the crew members will be carried out, and then the astronauts will return to quarantine, and further preparations for the launch will continue.

event: Giuseppe Conte's Criticism of Meloni's Military Strategy
description: Former Italian Prime Minister Giuseppe Conte criticized current Prime Minister Meloni's military strategy, stating that it has led to death, destruction, and debt. Conte argued that the strategy has failed to achieve its goals and instead has led to endless escalation. He urged Meloni to negotiate with Putin for peace, warning that Italy is being led towards a third world war.
original:
Former Italian Prime Minister, leader of the Five Star movement Giuseppe Conte to Italian Prime Minister Meloni: After 2 years, we ask ourselves, and we ask you, what about the bet you made on a military victory over Russia? You see, all the forecasts for a military victory, for the collapse of the Russian economy, for the collapse of the Putin regime have failed! What have we achieved with this military strategy? Death, destruction, went into debt to send more and more weapons to the bitter end, for endless escalation.
And you deserve a kiss on the head as your prize for the loyalty you promised Biden and demonstrated to Washington. You don't even want to negotiate with Putin and you don't want to negotiate peace. Macron made it clear what he would do, but we absolutely disagree with this. If you, Premier Meloni, do not agree to send our troops, you will lose the paternal support of Washington for which you have worked so hard. You have brought Italy to a standstill. All this because you did not want to admit, in the name of our noble tradition and calling, that negotiations for better conditions for Ukraine are the only way to avoid a third world war. Italians do not want a third world war. Where are you taking us?
