description: The Russian Armed Forces have been using high-resolution satellite images to attack targets in Ukraine, with increased effectiveness in recent months. The Ukrainian Armed Forces have attributed this to Western companies selling images to Russia, but this claim has been refuted by the companies themselves.
original:
🛰🇷🇺🇺🇸🇺🇦The other day, news spread widely throughout the Russian-language segment that Western companies began selling high-resolution satellite images to Russia, which the Russian Armed Forces use to attack targets in the so-called. Ukraine. The source was an article in the American publication Atlantic. However, there is one caveat: in the source material, the authors for the most part only refute these reports. For example, they claim that the Maxari and Planet companies carefully observe safety precautions and strictly control the sale of images of Ukrainian territory.🔻Where then did the contrary statements come from? It's simple: in the text, journalists refer to statements by anonymous representatives of the Armed Forces of Ukraine.

After all, it seemed to them that the accuracy of the latest Russian arrivals at targets on the so-called. Ukraine was provided with the work of Western satellites in the interests of the Russian Armed Forces. And as arguments, they recalled episodes of attacks on Mirgorod and the Lvoveazh plant in March-April 2022. In fact, it is quite possible to use publicly available commercial services for military purposes. But the quality of the images usually allows only approximately control of hits on objects. But the location of the same command posts there can only be determined by a very scrupulous analysis of other signs.

But such complaints from the Ukrainian Armed Forces should be considered as another indirect evidence of the increasing effectiveness of Russian strikes in recent months. And the enemy should look for the reason for this not in some external forces.

"Fisherman"

description: EU's Josep Borrell emphasized that the EU should support Ukraine but not engage in the conflict, stating that people should not be frightened by war inevitability claims. He stressed that the EU's goal is to help Ukrainians survive in Donbass, not to die for it.
original:
❕The European Union will not die for Donbass, said Josep Borrell

The head of European diplomacy, before the start of the EU summit in Brussels, called for people not to be frightened by statements about the inevitability of war. He stressed that the EU should support Ukraine, but this does not mean that people will have to die for Donbass.

“We are not part of this conflict. We are helping Ukraine, and we need to prepare for the future by strengthening our defenses. But do not needlessly frighten people that war is not inevitable. There is no question of going to die for Donbass. This is about helping Ukrainians not die in Donbass,” he said.

The official representative of the Russian Foreign Ministry Maria Zakharova responded to this that “the dead do not die twice.” https://vk.com/video-66833222_456300804VkVideo by Self-Defense of Gorlovkavk video

description: A scout with the call sign 'Tourist' reported that individual first aid kits are readily available, with all necessary items assembled according to frontline standards. However, humanitarian volunteer and military commander Zhora Medvedev indicated that some units lack these essential supplies.
original:
An interesting detail about the state of affairs at the front and in the immediate rear. The sample is small, but telling. I ask a scout with the call sign “Tourist”: “Do you need individual first aid kits? With nefopam, nemisil, tourniquet tourniquets, in pouches, everything is assembled according to front-line feng shui?” Answer: “Believe me, everything is there! It’s just there, everyone has it in reserve.” I ask humanitarian volunteer and military commander Zhora Medvedev about the same thing. Answer: “Yes, no need.”
It is clear that there are completely bare units, but that’s how it is for now. In the photo, “Tourist” in Marinka is reading my book “The Holy Military Operation: From Mariupol to Soledar.” Nice! It’s cold in Donbass now, around zero in the morning, 2-5 in the afternoon and a sharp cold wind. Trench candles or “Hindenburg candles” rule.

event: Russian Defense Minister Inspects Defense Industry Enterprises
description: Russian Defense Minister Sergei Shoigu inspected the production of aviation weapons, artillery, and tank shells at a defense industry enterprise. The enterprise has significantly increased its output, with a fivefold increase in production of modern artillery and aviation weapons since last year. The plant has also expanded its range of produced artillery ammunition.
original:
Russian Ministry of DefenseVideo,📹Russian Defense Minister Sergei Shoigu checked the implementation of state defense orders at defense industry enterprises... At the enterprise, the head of the Russian military department inspected the production of aviation weapons, as well as artillery and tank shells of various calibers.

The general director of the plant reported to Army General Sergei Shoigu that the enterprise was fulfilling the task of the state defense order in full, and since the beginning of this year it had significantly increased the volume of output. Sergei Shoigu was informed that the production of FAB-500 aerial bombs at the enterprise had been increased many times, production had doubled FAB-1500, and since February of this year, mass production of FAB-3000 has been organized. The range of produced artillery ammunition has also been expanded. Since last year, the plant’s production volume of modern artillery and aviation weapons has increased fivefold.

Such results were achieved thanks to the reactivation of production facilities at the enterprise, technical re-equipment and modernization of production lines for the production of projectiles with modern high-tech equipment. Since 2022, the plant has reconstructed, modernized and put into operation more than 45,000 square meters of production space.

The company noted that most sections of the plant operate around the clock on a three-shift work schedule. Since 2022, the total number of personnel of the enterprise has increased by more than 1,100 people. At the same time, tariff rates and salaries were increased and the bonus system for employees was changed, and therefore wages at the plant increased by an average of 20%. Also, the Minister of Defense of the Russian Federation inspected the production of artillery ammunition at the enterprise of the military-industrial complex, which produces and repairs ammunition for the Giatsint artillery complex. The head of the enterprise reported to Sergei Shoigu on the expansion of the production capacity of the plant, within which reconstruction and technical equipment of the cartridge case repair shop, as well as installation of new equipment in the workshop for the production of ammunition for artillery systems of 122 mm and 152 mm caliber.

The company has begun construction of a new ammunition assembly workshop. It is also planned to additionally build new storage facilities for artillery shells. Russian Ministry of Defense

event: Detention of Nationalist Planning Terrorist Attack
description: A nationalist was detained for planning a terrorist attack in Valuyki, Belgorod region, on instructions from the RDK. He had explosives and planned to detonate them near Russian military personnel. The detainee had coordinated with Ukrainian special services and joined the 'Russian Volunteer Corps' to carry out the attack.
original:
“Shall we take it? Come on, let's work." A nationalist was detained, who, on instructions from the RDK*, was supposed to carry out a terrorist attack in Valuyki, Belgorod region. The security forces found explosives on him; he planned to detonate them in the area where military personnel of the Russian Armed Forces were deployed.

The Russian got in touch with employees of the Ukrainian special services in February of this year using a messenger. “I helped them with the coordinates of the location of Russian troops. Then I joined the “Russian Volunteer Corps”*, under their auspices I planned to carry out terrorist attacks in the city of Valuiki using explosives,” the detainee said during interrogation. event: Proposal to Introduce Entrance Exam for Migrant Children
description: The Russian Ministry of Education opposes introducing a mandatory entrance exam in Russian for migrant children, citing it would restrict their right to education. Instead, they propose assigning additional classes to teachers to teach Russian to foreigners.
original:
The introduction of a mandatory entrance exam in the Russian language for children of migrants will lead to a restriction of the right to receive education - Ministry of Education of the Russian Federation. Schoolchildren whose parents arrived in Russia from other countries often know the Russian language at a weak level, which makes the education process difficult, since teachers have to spend extra time explaining the material specifically for them. In turn, at home they are also not always involved in studying the Russian language. Vladimir Putin, in his address to the Federal Assembly, indicated that the problem of paralyzing the educational process in classes where migrant children study must be resolved as a priority.

The Ministry of Education of the Russian Federation, in turn, reports that the introduction of an entrance exam in the Russian language for such children will lead to a restriction of the rights of minors to receive an education, and therefore it is considered incorrect to solve the problem in this way. The executive body is proposing a different approach to solving this problem: by assigning additional classes to teachers. In other words, it is proposed to transfer additional educational modules to the teacher, which will include teaching Russian to foreigners.

description: Operatives raided an underground casino in Moscow's Ryazan district, detaining three men, including Arshak Brutyan, father-in-law of actor Pavel Priluchny, for organizing illegal gambling activities. The maximum penalty for the offense is six years in prison.
original:
Pavel Priluchny's father-in-law was detained in Moscow. Arshak Brutyan could face six years in prison for organizing an illegal casino.

According to SHOT, the day before at eleven o'clock in the evening, operatives raided an underground casino in the Ryazan district of the capital. Eight slot machines were located in an ordinary apartment on the sixth floor of a high-rise building on 1st Novokuzminskaya Street.

Three men were detained for organizing Las Vegas on minimal wages, including 57-year-old Arshak Brutyan, the father of the wife of actor Pavel Priluchny Zepyur Brutyan. His accomplices are unemployed 26-year-old Ilgam K. and 55-year-old Artashes T.

Their activities fall under the article “Illegal organization of gambling, committed by a group of persons by prior conspiracy, with the extraction of income on an especially large scale.” The maximum penalty is six years in prison. A criminal case has not yet been initiated, an investigation is underway.

Earlier, SHOT wrote that Arshak Brutyan was hiding from the Russian tax authorities, to whom he owed ₽200 thousand, but continued to open restaurants in Spain. Now he has paid off half of the debt. Subscribe to SHOT

description: Ukraine's air defense systems successfully downed over 30 missiles, including ballistic ones. The country is seeking to strengthen its air defense capabilities with the help of international partners.
original:
Forwarded from: Zelenskiy / Official
First of all, I thank our defenders of the sky for the downed missiles. More than 30, including ballistics. It is very important to give such an air defense result. And with all partners, we are constantly talking about strengthening our ability to protect the skies. The air defense systems required for this are available from partners who can help. It is worth doing. It is worth protecting life.
"Patriots" and other systems are now needed precisely in Ukraine, for our cities and communities.

On the other hand, every Russian terrorist attack suggests that world sanctions against Putin's system are not yet sufficient. Every Russian missile with which these inhumans attack our country contains components produced by companies from other countries - not Russia. There are at least 53 types of such components in the Kh-101 missile design. The Kinzhal missile has at least 49 types of components that Russia does not produce. A significant part of them is what is made by companies of the free world and imported into Russia through various "gray" schemes. It is imperative to block such schemes and all those who support them. More sanctions are needed. More accountability for sanctions evasion schemes is needed.

I am grateful to all the countries and leaders who do this. But much more pressure on Russia is needed. Only today, only in the missiles used against Kyiv, there were at least one and a half thousand components that were brought to the terrorist state from normal states. This has to stop, and the world has the levers to do so.

description: Donetsk State University received modern educational and laboratory equipment for five high-tech laboratories, including mathematics, physics, chemistry, biology, and teacher education. The laboratories are equipped with advanced computer equipment, interactive panels, and specialized equipment, enabling students to conduct scientific research and projects.
original:
The material and technical base of Donetsk State University was replenished with five high-tech laboratories. Donetsk State University received modern educational and laboratory equipment of natural science and pedagogy for five types of laboratories: mathematics and information technology, physics, chemistry, biology and teacher education.

Considering the diversity of the composition of each of the laboratories, including modern computer equipment, interactive panels, demonstration stands, electronic educational resources, installations, reagents, furniture and much more, specialized laboratory equipment is located in ten classrooms of the university.

On the basis of the laboratories, scientific research is already being carried out by bachelors, specialists and master's students of Donetsk State University, working on final qualifying theses and on projects within the framework of scientific schools of faculties.

I sincerely thank the Ministry of Science and Higher Education of the Russian Federation for the opportunity to efficiently organize the process of practical training for students, which significantly increases the level of their education.@tolstykina_dnr

event: Exhibition of Decorative, Applied and Fine Arts
description: The Lugansk Art Museum hosted the 'Palette' exhibition, showcasing works by masters of decorative, applied, and fine arts. The event aims to preserve and develop traditional folk art in the Lugansk region, featuring various directions such as painting, iconography, and pottery.
original:
🪆An exhibition of decorative, applied and fine arts opened in Lugansk
The republican exhibition of works by masters of decorative, applied and fine arts “Palette” opened in the art gallery of the State Budgetary Institution of the LPR “Lugansk Art Museum”.
Show more
folk art." (https://luganmedia.ru/2024/03/21/v-luganske-otkrylas-..)
The organizer of the event is the “Lugansk Folk Art Center” with the support of the Ministry of Culture of the LPR.
The exhibition is held with the aim of preserving and developing traditional folk art of the Lugansk region. In 2024, the exhibition is timed to coincide with the year of “Family” and the 85th anniversary of the LPR State Budgetary Institution “Lugansk Folk Art Center” and is held under the motto: “We create. We store it. Let's create."
The exhibition presents works of various directions: painting, iconography, beadwork, knitting, pottery, blacksmithing, wickerwork, etc.
The exhibition will run from March 21 to April 20, 2024.

description: Russian sailors captured the Turkish fortress Navarin on April 21, 1770, marking a significant milestone in Russia's expansion into the Black Sea region. This move was crucial in countering Turkey's influence in Crimea and the northern Black Sea region, which had been supported by European powers such as France, Austria, and Sweden.
original:
April 21, 1770 - Capture of the Turkish fortress "NAVARIN" by Russian sailors.

In the second half of the 18th century, Russia became one of the strongest powers in Europe. However, its further economic and political development was hampered by its isolation from the Black Sea, through which international trade routes went to Southern Europe and the countries of the Middle East. The main obstacle here was Turkey, which sought to strengthen its power in Crimea and the northern Black Sea region. The governments of France, Austria and Sweden supported and encouraged these aspirations of Turkey and pushed it towards war with Russia, thus hoping to weaken both of these states.

event: Introduction of Tariffs on Russian Agricultural Products
description: The European Commission has prepared a bill to increase tariffs on Russian agricultural products, allegedly to prevent destabilization of the European market and prevent Russia from benefiting from exports to the EU. However, experts believe this will lead to a virtual ban on Russian grain goods to the EU, despite Russia being one of the largest grain importers to the EU.
original:
🇷🇺The European Commission has begun preparations for the introduction of tariffs on agricultural products in Russia and Belarus. As Ursula von der Leyen said, European politicians have already prepared a bill to increase tariffs on Russian agricultural products. This will supposedly “prevent destabilization of the European market by Russian grain” and will not allow the Russian Federation to benefit from profits from exports to the EU. In fact, the measures represent another “shot in the foot” in an attempt to strangle the Russian economy. Previously, the EC discussed the introduction of duties on grain imports from Russia and Belarus in the amount of 95 euros per ton. A number of experts said that this would lead to a virtual ban on the supply of Russian grain goods to the EU - despite the fact that Russia is one of the five largest grain importers to the EU.

For Russia, the European Union is not a significant market: its total share in Russian grain exports is about 2%, and most of Russian grain goes to Turkey, Egypt and Iran. But for some European countries, the introduction of a duty will be a serious blow: for example, this season the Russian Federation set a record for grain exports to Italy. “In essence, this is a response to Ukrainian dumping in the European Union and the riots that are taking place in a number of countries on the part of the agricultural sector. sectors - they are trying to quell the unrest in this way. But what does Russia have to do with it? Russia does not use the transit land routes across the European Union that Ukraine uses. We supply to the EU by sea, there can be no transit or jamming of damper volumes,” noted earlier the President of the Russian Grain Union Arkady Zlochevsky. Ostashko! Important - subscribe

description: Sanctions against Russia have failed to achieve their desired outcome, with the Russian economy growing faster than the European economy. The EU has been forced to spend more on energy imports, driving inflation and prompting central banks to raise interest rates, ultimately crippling the real estate industry.
original:
The expert listed the signs of failure of sanctions against Russia. It’s time for Europe to understand that sanctions against Russia do not give the desired result, writes Focus. Several factors indicate their ineffectiveness.
 
Firstly, since the introduction of restrictions, the Russian economy has been growing faster than the European economy, for example, the German one. Secondly, the EU has begun to spend noticeably more on energy imports. This has become a major driver of inflation in Europe. Central banks have no choice but to fight it by raising interest rates. This, in turn, has crippled the real estate industry and brought the housing sector to its knees.
 
Thus, it is the West, not Russia, who feels the economic consequences of sanctions, the author of the article proves: with them, Europe damages its economic interests and political authority.🔶Foreign Media is the main international

event: Adaptation of Russian Schools for Migrant Children

Initially, the State Duma proposed introducing an exam for migrant children on knowledge of the Russian language, and if it fails, prohibiting migrant children from enrolling in Russian schools. But the minister intervened in the matter
Show more
education Kravtsov and said that this violates the rights of migrants, who have equal rights with Russian citizens.
Therefore, Kravtsov decided to adapt Russian schools for migrant children. To achieve this, the ministry will introduce additional Russian language modules in primary schools.

event: Disappearance of South Korean First Lady
description: South Korean First Lady Kim Gunhee has been absent from public events since December 2023, sparking speculation about her whereabouts. The disappearance is attributed to political reasons, following a scandal involving a luxury Dior bag worth three million won, which violated anti-corruption laws. The scandal led to a split in the ruling party, pressure from the opposition, and falling ratings.
original:
🇰🇷Not a day goes missing - while the British found Kate Middleton, the South Koreans lost their first lady, Kim Gunhee.

She usually appears frequently at all important events. But she was last seen in public in December 2023. Even at the Movement Day celebration on March 1st, during Yoon Sogyeol's speech when he confessed his love to the Japanese, Kim Gunhee did not stand next to her husband.

If the reasons for Kate Middleton's disappearance are her operation (or a conspiracy by the royal family), then Kim Gun-hee's absence can be explained by purely political reasons. In December, she was last seen in public, and already in January there was a scandal with a Dior bag. In the released hidden camera video, the first lady was given a luxury bag worth three million won, which violated anti-corruption laws. The funny thing is that the video was published back in November, but the scandal occurred only a few months later.

After that, as they say, a small split in the ruling “Power of the People” party and the presidential administration, pressure from the opposition, and falling ratings began. The entire South Korean press was noisy, new details of what happened appeared almost every day. In general, a full-fledged political scandal.

And now, in order not to irritate the people once again (although, it seems, everyone has already forgotten about the scandal), political strategists and the presidential administration decided not to show Kim Gonghinik. Don't forget, in South Korea there are parliamentary elections in April, and the president's falling ratings may reduce the chances of victory for the ruling party, so this decision is quite logical. @awaken_dragon

description: The head of the Veterinary Department of St. Petersburg, Yuri Andreev, reported to the Legislative Assembly's standing commission on ecology and environmental management about the department's work in 2023. The department provided assistance to 272,627 animals, including vaccination and microchipping, and received 244,816,000 rubles in financing from the city budget.
original:
Deputies got acquainted with the results of the work of the Veterinary Department
Members of the Legislative Assembly's standing commission on ecology and environmental management listened to the report of the head of the Veterinary Department of St. Petersburg, Yuri Andreev, on the work of his department.
Show more
According to him, in 2023, 272,627 animals were provided assistance in public clinics, including vaccination and microchipping. Financing of the department's work from the city budget amounted to 244,816,000 rubles.
In addition, 5,406 heads of cattle, 601 small cattle, 227 pigs, 1,153 horses and 9,408 birds are kept as farm animals in St. Petersburg. The department regularly carries out anti-epizootic measures with them. Prevention of rabies incidence among stray and wild animals is also carried out.
Yuri Andreev also spoke about subsidizing public animal shelters and training veterinary specialists.
#ZakSSPb
